title: Investing Based on When You Need the Money: A Strategic Approach
subtitle: Understanding Time Horizons for Better Investment Decisions
content:
Investing Based on When You Need the Money: A Strategic Approach

I'm Tyler, I'm a former financial advisor and portfolio manager, and now I make financial content for free so you don't have to pay for it.

1. For Zero to Two Years

Invest 100% in cash or bonds. Consider using BND or SGOV. Do not put short-term money in stocks. I don't care if the market's up 30%. You need stability, not growth.

2. For Two to Seven Years

Allocate 50% in stocks through VTI or VOO, and 50% in bonds or cash through BND or SGOV. Work backwards towards when you need the money. By year seven, you could be 100% in stocks, as long as by year two, you're 100% in bonds or cash.

3. For Seven Plus Years

If you need the money in seven or more years, or don't know when you would need it, invest 100% in stocks through a total stock market fund like VTI or a growth fund like VUG. You have time for the volatility to smooth out and expect higher returns overall. Again, work backwards. By year two, be 100% in bonds or cash.
